content:
1. A new employee at a company tries to fit in with their colleagues by adopting their mannerisms and speech patterns, but their attempts are met with ridicule and teasing. They begin to feel self-conscious and uncomfortable, unsure of whether they are being made fun of or if they are truly a part of the group.
2. A college student studying abroad tries to fit in with their host country by adopting the local accent and customs, but their attempts are met with teasing and snickering by their classmates. They begin to feel like they are being made fun of and struggle to maintain their sense of identity in a foreign culture.
3. A young person moving to a new city tries to fit in with the local community by adopting their slang and fashion, but their attempts are met with disdain and sarcasm. They begin to feel like they are being made fun of and struggle to find acceptance in their new home.
4. A new member in a group of friends is trying to fit in by adopting their shared affectations but her attempts are met with jokes and mocking, leaving her feeling left out and isolated.
5. An employee in a creative field adopt the affectations of their colleagues and manager, but as they begin to present the same ideas and style, they begin to feel like they are being made fun of, by not being considered as an original creator.
6. A person at a new job adopts affectations of the company culture, but the rest of the team is using these affectations in a self-mocking way, which the new employee doesn't understand, and left out of the jokes.
